newsitem.title: CHINA: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Feb 13.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Feb 13.

text.p: Following is a summary of major Chinese political and business stories in leading newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Beijing. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (8610) 6532-1921. Fax: (8610) 6532-4978.
- With reform of the grain circulation system, state-run grain enterprises in Shanghai, and Shandong and Hunan provinces have increased profits
- Front-pate commentary calls on state-run grain enterprises to eliminate losses and increase profits.
- State Statistical Bureau report shows 40 percent of production capacity in 28 sectors lies idle
- Shanghai industrial sector showed improved efficiency last year and turned out more high-quality products.
- Commentary praises Fu Wei, a deceased regimental commander who dedicated his life to national defence.
- Minister of Internal Trade Chen Bangzhu urges large stores to boost management and halt falling profits
- State Development Bank recalls total of 31.524 billion yuan in loan interest in 1996
- Editorial says planned cut in bank reserve requirements will not lead to loosening of monetary policy
- China makes provincial governments responsible for supplying rice and rice flour to the army
- All central government administrative departments must hire all low-ranking civil servants based on open examinations and merit appraisals starting this year.
- The state will draft several national regulations this year to standardise management of floating population and improve reproductive services for women.
